roleset.name: generally positive: morally good, pleasing

example.name: arg1
example.text: This cake is much better than the last one you made.
example.arg: than the last one you made

example.name: arg1
example.text: Everything is better when its free.

example.name: both args
example.text: He was better to me than anyone had ever been.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, BOLT-4,5; comparative form of good.01, well.02.

roleset.name: more skilled at

example.name: both args, CXN
example.text: He's better at playing the piano than I am.

example.name: arg1
example.text: As piano players, between John and Mary, John is better.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, BOLT-4,5; comparative form of good.02.

roleset.name: beneficial, healthy for

example.name: both args, CXN
example.text: Broad leaf parsley is better for you than eating the plate.

example.name: You say "yay", I say "neigh"
example.text: Horse meat is better for you than beef, according to a scion of one of the country's most prestigious butchery families.
example.arg: according to a scion of one of the country's most prestigious butchery families

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, BOLT-4,5; comparative form of good.04.

roleset.name: not as ill as before

example.name: both args
example.text: I am sooo relieved that he is better from his bout with rotovirus.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT-4,5; comparative form of well-j.01

roleset.name: in more fortunate circumstances

role.descr: situation/state that allows arg1 to be more fortunate

example.name: both args
example.text: Sony CEO Kaz Hirai has said that the company's film and device units are better off together.
example.arg: the company's film and device units

example.name: both args
example.text: I just happen to think people are better off doing something they actually like.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT-4,5; comparative form of well-j.03, well-j.04.
